I was looking forward to seeing this the first time I heard about this new Madea project. This is Tyler Perry's first Cartoon movie and it was so great like his other productions. Madea gets in trouble with the Po-Po again and it's hysterical which She faces a Judge that sentences her to Community Service and later House Arrest. Tyler Perry voices Madea, Uncle Joe and Brian like his other Madea Movies that relied on laughs and heart, this one was sure full of everything a Madea movie has and wants like her others. Aunt Bam appears in this as well which makes it even better and funnier. It's a great cartoon for everyone to watch and enjoy. If you love Madea and Tyler Perry, add this new film to your Tyler Perry Collection, it's sure is a great addition to your collection. Can't wait to see more Madea and Tyler Perry in the future.

Animated like a cartoon pilot episode. Boring, most generic plot ever. Seriously,they went with the "save the community center" cliche? Me and my friends got it for a laugh, but it was so poorly paced, cringey and uninteresting we couldn't even enjoy it ironically. I guess it will keep a toddler's attention for a few minutes, or serves as an example for what not to do when making a cartoon, but as an adult who loves animation and does animation and art, this is downright depressing. Stick with the corny live action melodramas, they're  a lot funnier to watch.

I love all things Madea, so I decided to purchase this cartoon DVD for my grandchildren. They have watched it so many times, they pretty much know the movie line by line. It teaches children about breaking the law and suffering the consequences of your behavior.  Children need to learn this lesson, but adults need to learn it at times too. Madea is sentenced to community service as a result of her run in with the PoPo (police). There are several lessons, the importance of family and giving each other lots of love. My granddaughter is 4 and my grandson 8, they both love it. I hope Tyler Perry comes out with another cartoon soon.

I enjoyed it. It showed how we must be held accountable for the choices we make. In Madea's case, she is sentenced to community service due to her irresponsible behavior and unwise choices. As a result of being sentenced to community service, she's able to turn her negative conduct into a positive - saving the youth center. She taught those children some valuable life lessons. They were taught the importance of respecting their elders and how to persevere during unfavorable circumstances. They were taught indirectly that love can come in different wrappings.

I know that many viewers would probably argue that Madea's not much of a role model to the youth and it's perfectly fine to feel that way. However, it was clear that those children weren't concerned with Madea's background. They were more concerned with her bailing out on them once she completed her time. Those children only saw a woman who had her own way of showing how much she cared for them. In reality, it's not usually the children who are concerned with an individual's background. It's typically the adults who judge others based on their background and act as if they're no longer useful to the world. I do recall the lady politician making reference to Madea's background on more than one occasion. Often times children are not taught morals and values in their home and it sometimes takes a Madea to teach them. Some children have never been shown genuine love until a Madea shows up in their life. We must understand that children just want to be loved. They could care less about who shows it to them. If only we could be like the children.

I would recommend this dvd to parents of small and teenage children.  Many may be reluctant to purchase the dvd because they're turned off by Madea being in trouble with the law. Please don't allow that one little minor detail to keep you from purchasing it. In my opinion, you'll be glad you did. My husband and I watched it along with our son and we enjoyed it. It's always good to see love being spread around and a little laughter never hurt anyone. I look forward to seeing more of the animated Madea.

Catrina Thomas
The kids love this movie and keeps watching it over and over.

Tyler Perry's Madea's Tough Love movie is funny and engaging for all ages. The movie centers around Madea being forced to interact and help a group of inner city children. This short movie involves colorful characters, quick moving plots, and of course Madea's outrageous commentary. Overall, a non-violent funny cartoon with diverse characters. Tip- pay attention to the political hints throughout the video (the mayor) they hold certain truths. I appreciate you for taking time out to read my review.
